sections_array.prompt:
Provide a structured summary of the application lifecycle and environment classification for Customer Rewards portal. Include the following details for each environment (Dev, SIT, Test, PAT, Pre-Prod, Production):

Business Criticality
Service Category
Information Classification

Also include the overall application-level classification. Format the output as a table with columns for:

Environment
Business Criticality
Service Category
Information Classification

List and describe the key business drivers for [Application Name]. Include at least three drivers, explaining their importance to the business and how they impact the application's development and maintenance.

Provide a structured list of key contacts supporting the migration of [Application Name] to Azure. For each contact, include: Full Name, Email Address, Title or Role. Format the output as a table with columns: Full Name, Email, Title.

Provide a detailed migration strategy for the [Application Name] being moved to Azure. Include: Service Name, Application Name, Environment (e.g., Dev, Pre-Prod, Production), Migration Pattern like Rehost or Redeploy or Replatform for each tier (Application, Database, Presentation, Middleware etc.), Complexity Level. Format the output as a table with the following columns: Service Name, App Name, Environment, Migration Pattern, Complexity.

parameters.name: Approach
parameters.Rehost: Low-touch: Tool-based migration by servers or subnet, AVS migrations using VMware HCX
parameters.Redeploy: High-touch: Deployment of new servers by application

parameters.name: Effort
parameters.Rehost: Simple: Light assessment and planning; minimal application owner involvement
parameters.Replatform: Medium: Standard assessment and planning; moderate application owner involvement
parameters.Redeploy: Complex: Deep assessment and planning; significant application owner involvement

parameters.name: Planning
parameters.Replatform: Guided by an Application Migration Plan
parameters.Redeploy: Guided by both an Application Migration Plan and an Application Deployment Plan

parameters.name: Outcomes
parameters.Rehost: As-is migration of servers to Azure IaaS or AVS
parameters.Replatform: As-is migration of application to Azure IaaS or AVS; OS upgrade available via automation (Complex Application Migration only)
parameters.Redeploy: Optimization includes Infrastructure-as-Code, new OS version, and upgraded application components; targeting Azure IaaS, AVS, or PaaS

parameters.name: Databases
parameters.Rehost: Databases, if any, migrated as part of server migration
parameters.Replatform: Simple/Medium complexity databases migrated to Azure IaaS, AVS, or PaaS
parameters.Redeploy: Simple/Medium complexity databases migrated to Azure IaaS, AVS, or PaaS

parameters.name: Migration Velocity
parameters.Rehost: Fast: Accelerates migration to Azure IaaS or AVS with little application owner involvement
parameters.Replatform: Medium: Migration velocity dependent upon customer resource availability for UAT
parameters.Redeploy: Varies: Migration velocity dependent upon customer resource availability for planning/UAT and number of scale components

parameters.name: Scale/High-Availability
parameters.Redeploy: Ability to deploy new scaling/HA solution including VM Scale Sets, Availability Zones, etc.

parameters.name: UAT/Cutover
parameters.Rehost: Simple: Limited to OS health; combined UAT and cutover
parameters.Replatform: Medium: Combined UAT and cutover; test failover possible for limited pre-cutover testing
parameters.Redeploy: Complex: Full UAT possible prior to cutover event

parameters.name: Target Workloads
parameters.Rehost: Best suited to non-production and less critical workloads
parameters.Replatform: Best suited to production and important workloads where cutover and UAT can be performed together
parameters.Redeploy: Best suited to production and business critical workloads where complex UAT must be performed in advance of cutover

parameters.name: Out of Scope
parameters.Rehost: Container to Container Migrations, Highly Complex Applications (e.g., BizTalk, SAP, Teradata, Oracle EBS), Unix systems requiring rewrite, Mainframe OS, Citrix Systems

sections_array.prompt: For each environment provide the Azure cost in a tabular format with the following columns Environment, Cost. The data has to be fetched from Azure Migrate Assessment Report document in the Azure AI search.

Identify and describe the key security considerations for [Application Name] in the context of its migration to Azure. Include aspects such as data protection, access controls, and compliance requirements.
Outline the resiliency configurations that should be implemented for [Application Name] in Azure. Include details on high availability, disaster recovery, and backup strategies.
